result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy A. Swan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: to Minnesota case

records.addlTxt: follow up letter requesting an amended JOC and date committed by DOC
from DOC Kathryn Galarowicz requesting clarification as to the date committed for count 1 and amended JOC to reflect date committed.
(Same one filed on 10-28-2015 from the DOC) This has a correction requested by the Defendant and noted by the Court.

10:05  Defendant Timothy A. Swan in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nelson objects to the information in C. Gilles' report regarding a sharpie marker incident. The court will make a note of the objection and send notification to DOC regarding that objection.  State recomendation:  complete sex offender program  register as a sex offender,  have no contact with minors and the victim .  5 - 6 yrs confinement  3-4  ES  8-10 Total sentence.  Victim rights  have been complied with. Atty Nelson addresses the sentence. Asking for a concurrent sentence if confinement is ordered. Requests 15 years supervision beginning immediately. 532 days credit which she is asking for. 10:54 Court will recess for 10 minutes.   11:01  Court resumes.  Court orders - S/W Probation 15 yrs.  Conditions:  No possession of alcohol or lillegal drugs  DNA sample & surcharge  No contact with NEC  DOB 8-8-90 or any members of immediate famly. No contact with any minors without prior approval  Comply with sex offender registry.    Complly with sex offender treatment. Counseling as required by the agent.  Court costs  Supervision costs   Jail credit will be given after DA Froelich gets back to the Judge by the end of the day. 541 days credit.
Sentencing hearing at 11-03-2015 10:00 am.

1:03  Defendant Timothy A. Swan in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich  Plead to charage State would request a PSI  State will cap their recomedation to the PSI recomendations.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge.  PSI is ordered. Set for sentencing.
Plea hearing at 09-03-2015 01:00 pm.
State's Proposed
for Impeachment by Prior Convictions filed by Atty Froelich
Scheduling Order.  JA cc'd attorneys.

Final pre-trial at 08-18-2015 11:45 am.
Jury trial at 09-03-2015 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 07-02-2015 02:45 pm.
State's
LN
Pre-trial conference at 07-22-2015 11:30 am.
Def pleas not guilty. Court accepts and enters in not guilty plea.

1:08 Defendant Timothy A. Swan in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Timothy A. Swan in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant. Def waives his right to have a preliminary hearing. Court approves the waiver; finds the defendant probably commited a felony; binds the Def over.   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant. Court reads charges and maximum penalty. Def waives further reading.
Preliminary hearing at 06-03-2015 01:00 pm

Bond conditions read to the Defendant by the Court Commissioner.

4:30 Defendant Timothy A. Swan in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears in court with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Froelich: $1000 cash bond with no contact. Nelson has no objection. Def does qualify for the PD. Def was in the Navy and National Guard.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Copy of Detainer Forms I, II, III, IV and VI and an original of Detainer Form VII filed by Atty Froelich
